content:
• Tuesday, August 14, 2012
  • GRPN

    Groupon (GRPN -27%) had its defenders on this dark day. Barrington praised Groupon's market...

    Groupon (GRPN -27%) had its defenders on this dark day. Barrington praised Groupon's market share and brand, and estimates it trades at just a 7.1x 2012 EV/free cash flow multiple. And SA's Drew Handy is impressed with the rapid growth of Groupon's e-commerce business. Critics, meanwhile, focused not only on slowing growth, but also Groupon's people issues. Namely, that it may have too many, and is having problems managing them. (more) (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:02 PM | 10 Comments
  • KITD

    KIT digital (OTC:KITD): Q2 EPS of -$1.99 may not be comparable to consensus of $-0.36. Revenue...

    KIT digital (OTC:KITD): Q2 EPS of -$1.99 may not be comparable to consensus of $-0.36. Revenue of $51.1M (+13.6% Y/Y) beats by $6M. Shares -4.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM
  • VIAV

    More on JDS Uniphase's FQ4: The company expects FQ1 revenue of $415M-$435M, in-line with a...

    More on JDS Uniphase's FQ4: The company expects FQ1 revenue of $415M-$435M, in-line with a $427.1M consensus. That's better than many feared, given the telecom capex environment. FQ4 optical component sales fell 10.9% Y/Y, but that's much better than FQ3's 22.5% drop. Test equipment sales (previous) fell 7.1%, and advanced optical sales, which include Kinect components, fell 1%. JDSU +5.7% AH. FNSR +2.3%. OCLR +4%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM
  • BOBE

    More on Bob Evans (BOBE -1%): FQ1 misses slightly on both its top and bottom line as sales were...

    More on Bob Evans (BOBE -1%): FQ1 misses slightly on both its top and bottom line as sales were mostly flat Y/Y. The company raises its FY13 EPS view higher however, Citing positive revenue trends and earnings accretion from recent acquisitions. It now expects to earn between $2.67 - $2.73, higher than Street consensus estimates of $2.66. Earnings growth rate projections are also raised to approximately 7% - 10% over the next five years.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • OXSQ

    TICC Capital (TICC -1.8% AH) commences a secondary offering of 2M shares (current float is about...

    TICC Capital (TICC -1.8% AH) commences a secondary offering of 2M shares (current float is about 37.8M shares). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • SHOR

    ShoreTel (NASDAQ:SHOR): FQ4 EPS of $0.00 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $78.5M (+38.9% Y/Y) beats by...

    ShoreTel (NASDAQ:SHOR): FQ4 EPS of $0.00 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $78.5M (+38.9% Y/Y) beats by $4M. Shares +1.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM
  • MYGN

    Myriad Genetics (NASDAQ:MYGN): FQ4 EPS of $0.34 in-line. Revenue of $133M (+23.8% Y/Y) beats by...

    Myriad Genetics (NASDAQ:MYGN): FQ4 EPS of $0.34 in-line. Revenue of $133M (+23.8% Y/Y) beats by $1M. Shares -2.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM
  • SORL

    SORL Auto Parts (SORL -5.8%) goes out near its lows after missing on its Q2 top line earlier...

    SORL Auto Parts (SORL -5.8%) goes out near its lows after missing on its Q2 top line earlier today. Net earnings dropped 40% Y/Y amid weak car sales in China and abroad. The Chinese maker of brake systems for commercial vehicles also lowered its guidance for the year, now expecting FY12 revenue to come in around $198M, below Street estimates of $210M. It also lowers its net income guidance to $11.1M from $14.6M.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM
  • VIAV

    JDS Uniphase (JDSU): FQ4 EPS of $0.15 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $439M (-6.8% Y/Y) beats by...

    JDS Uniphase (JDSU): FQ4 EPS of $0.15 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $439M (-6.8% Y/Y) beats by $11M. Shares +4.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM
  • BOBE

    Bob Evans Farms (NASDAQ:BOBE): FQ1 EPS of $0.58 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $409.7M (+1.1% Y/Y)...

    Bob Evans Farms (NASDAQ:BOBE): FQ1 EPS of $0.58 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $409.7M (+1.1% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -2.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM
  • FB

    Facebook (FB -5.7%) news roundup: 1) S&P is upgrading to Buy, arguing insiders are unlikely...

    Facebook (FB -5.7%) news roundup: 1) S&P is upgrading to Buy, arguing insiders are unlikely to be big sellers at current levels when a lock-up expires on Thursday. 2) U.K. regulators have approved the Instagram acquisition. The FTC is still reviewing. 3) Facebook.com has 235M monthly game players (25% of total users), up 8% from January but slower than total Facebook user growth (likely due to the mobile shift). 150M monthly users are now relying on App Center.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM | 8 Comments
  • GMCR

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (NASDAQ:GMCR) slump over the last 30 minutes of trading...

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (NASDAQ:GMCR) slump over the last 30 minutes of trading to close at $22.85. A presentation (webcast) by management was going pretty smoothly until the slide (.pdf) tipping off that the company plans to tier K-cup prices. GMCR -6.6% on the day, down another 1.1% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM
  • LPRI

    Lone Pine Resources (LPR -33%) gets pounded today after the Canadian oil and gas company...

    Lone Pine Resources (LPR -33%) gets pounded today after the Canadian oil and gas company reported a Q2 net loss of -$0.14 per share. Revenues fell nearly 14% to $42.4M, due largely to declines in natural gas prices and volumes. The company also reduced its FY12 capital budget by about $40M to around $160M to $175M, saying that going forward it plans to focus on cost-efficient infield drilling opportunities at its Evi properties in the Peace River Arch in Northern Alberta.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM
  • CIE

    Cobalt Energy (CIE +13.1%) powers higher as Deutsche Bank calls it "the stock to own in 2013."...

    Cobalt Energy (CIE +13.1%) powers higher as Deutsche Bank calls it "the stock to own in 2013." The firm says the recent selloff was overdone, and the near-term floor value at its Cameia site offshore Angola likely is reduced for now, but the long-term impact on CIE's portfolio is unquestionably positive.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 PM
  • VALE

    Vale (VALE -3.6%) sees “early signals” of recovery in China's economy, but "we are...

    Vale (VALE -3.6%) sees “early signals” of recovery in China's economy, but "we are not going to see the spectacular growth rates of 10%, 12% per year... the golden years are gone," Vale says. The top iron ore producer shipped ~44% of its iron ore and pellets to Chinese steelmakers in Q2, and iron ore prices have dropped to their lowest since Dec. 2009 - not an upbeat combo.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:26 PM | 2 Comments
  • NCR

    Wedbush weighs in on NCR (NCR -9%), cutting it to Neutral on the back of recent reports that...

    Wedbush weighs in on NCR (NCR -9%), cutting it to Neutral on the back of recent reports that it's violating international sanctions and anti-bribery laws. The firm says NCR's emerging-markets business is crucial to growth, and faces a major hit if its foreign practices come under broad investigation. The company is looking into whistleblower allegations it violated sanctions on Syria and anti-bribery laws in China and the Mideast.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:20 PM | 1 Comment
  • ANGI

    Angie's List (ANGI -15.4%) dives after an IPO lock-up expiration ends. Investors holding 44% of...

    Angie's List (ANGI -15.4%) dives after an IPO lock-up expiration ends. Investors holding 44% of the review site's outstanding shares became eligible to sell today. Groupon's collapse likely isn't helping matters either.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM
  • SKYW

    SkyWest (SKYW +2.4%) gains on an upgrade to Neutral at Bank of America Merrill Lynch today....

    SkyWest (SKYW +2.4%) gains on an upgrade to Neutral at Bank of America Merrill Lynch today. Merrill says that efforts to rein in costs are bearing fruit faster than anticipated, and the likelihood of modest growth returning in Q4 should benefit the airline over the short term.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM
  • AONEQ

    A123 Systems (AONE -7.6%) tumbles after two Senators join a Congressman in questioning the...

    A123 Systems (AONE -7.6%) tumbles after two Senators join a Congressman in questioning the company's $450M investment from China's Wanxiang Group. The White House has tried to soothe concerns by stating none of A123's DOE funds will go to building overseas facilities. Yesterday, A123 fell on news a Fisker Karma sedan, which uses A123's batteries, had caught fire. Fisker replaced its CEO today.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM | 2 Comments
  • TAT

    TransAtlantic Petroleum (TAT +6.9%) says the conditions that led to substantial doubt about the...

    TransAtlantic Petroleum (TAT +6.9%) says the conditions that led to substantial doubt about the company's ability to continue as a going concern at year-end 2011 no longer exist as of the end of Q2. TAT also reports Q2 EPS of $0.02 on revenues of $32.6M (-7.2% Y/Y).

     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM
  • SHW

    Paint maker Valspar (VAL -3.8%) slides after it misses on its top line FQ3 result this morning....

    Paint maker Valspar (VAL -3.8%) slides after it misses on its top line FQ3 result this morning. The quarter was impacted by scant top-line growth, as the company suffered from weak international sales. Domestically however, sales grew by double-digits thanks to home-improvement stores like LOW building its seasonal inventory.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM
  • KIOR

    KiOR (KIOR -16%) is among the day's biggest losers after failing to recognize any revenue in the...

    KiOR (KIOR -16%) is among the day's biggest losers after failing to recognize any revenue in the latest quarter, though its $0.22/share loss was a penny better than estimates. The good news is the maker of cellulosic gasoline and diesel fuel now expects to begin production at its Georgia plant in September, and final costs for the plant will be 4% lower than originally estimated.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM | 1 Comment
  • ASTI

    Ascent Solar (OTC:ASTI +29%) is going parabolic for the second day in a row (previous) after...

    Ascent Solar (OTC:ASTI +29%) is going parabolic for the second day in a row (previous) after announcing a solar charger/case for Samsung's Galaxy S III - shares are now up 56% since the announcement was made. Today's gains come even though Cantor is reiterating a Sell: the firm notes past consumer products have failed to generate revenue, and predicts Ascent will run out of cash in 1H13.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM
  • SGMS

    Scientific Games (SGMS -10%) gets hammered today after Deutsche cut the shares to Hold and...

    Scientific Games (SGMS -10%) gets hammered today after Deutsche cut the shares to Hold and reduced its price target to $7 from $10. Deutsche cites the stagnated trajectory its business model and weakening trends reported in its Q2. It adds that consensus forecasts for H2 and FY13 are too aggressive and near term news flow is also likely to serve as a headwind for the stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:58 PM
  • KCG

    Knight Capital (KCG +6.7%) is bouncing sharply as the company reportedly discovers the cause of...

    Knight Capital (KCG +6.7%) is bouncing sharply as the company reportedly discovers the cause of its software glitch that distorted trading in hundreds of stocks. Two sources told Bloomberg that KCG inadvertently triggered an old software program as it was implementing a new one; the mistake multiplied trades by 1,000x and flooded the market with orders.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:55 PM | 1 Comment
  • CPRI

    Shares of Michael Kors (KORS +14.6%) surge as the luxury retailer remains the envy of peers with...

    Shares of Michael Kors (KORS +14.6%) surge as the luxury retailer remains the envy of peers with its winning recipe of boosting same-store sales. Execs in a CC (transcript) indicate that the firm's "shop-in-shops" concept performed even better than expected and say it will use a "measured" approach to a similar rollout of its jewelry business in H2. Another KORS read-through: Strong sales of watches bodes well for Fossil (NASDAQ:FOSL).

     
     
     
     
    | 1:27 PM
  • GEVO

    Gevo (GEVO +1%) files a lawsuit for declaratory judgment against Butamax Advanced Biofuels,...

    Gevo (GEVO +1%) files a lawsuit for declaratory judgment against Butamax Advanced Biofuels, DuPont (DD -0.3%) and BP (BP +0.6%) seeking a judicial determination that a recently issued Butamax Patent is invalid and that GEVO doesn't infringe on it. Yesterday, the Federal Court of Appeals had granted the company permission to continue selling its own bio-isobutanol pending further decision.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:51 PM
  • PWRD

    Perfect World (PWRD +6.6%) rallies after Citi starts coverage with a Buy as part of a broader...

    Perfect World (PWRD +6.6%) rallies after Citi starts coverage with a Buy as part of a broader launch for Chinese gaming stocks. The firm notes PWRD trades at almost zero equity value exc. net cash due to concerns about declining sales, and predicts existing games and overseas licensing will keep cash flow healthy. Citi also thinks a dividend could arrive later this year. Also receiving Buy ratings (I, II) are Changyou.com (CYOU +0.5%) and Giant Interactive (GA +2%).

     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM | 2 Comments
  • ROSG-OLD

    Rosetta Genomics (ROSG-OLD +7.7%) has been awarded by Frost & Sullivan with the 2012 North...

    Rosetta Genomics (ROSG-OLD +7.7%) has been awarded by Frost & Sullivan with the 2012 North American Next Generation Diagnostics Entrepreneurial Company of the Year Award for its work with cancer biomarkers and micro-RNA-based diagnostics.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:17 PM
  • NBR

    Options have been bullish in energy companies for several weeks, and now it's Nabors Industries'...

    Options have been bullish in energy companies for several weeks, and now it's Nabors Industries' (NBR +3.5%) turn as shares power higher for the second straight day. OptionMonster is seeing sizable buying in Sept. 16 and 17 calls on triple the average daily volume; calls outnumbered puts yesterday by five to one, a reflection of the bullish sentiment.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM | 1 Comment
  • ELN

    Elan (ELN +1.1%) trades higher this morning after UBS ups the shares to Buy, citing the spin-off...

    Elan (ELN +1.1%) trades higher this morning after UBS ups the shares to Buy, citing the spin-off of its Discovery Science and Neotope Biosciences businesses. The firm says the move turns it into a Tysabri-focused company with significant growth and under-appreciated operating leverage. Additionally, S&P put the stock's rating on creditwatch with positive implications, saying the spinoff is likely to lead to a better risk profile.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM | 1 Comment
  • KYAK

    Like Palo Alto Networks, travel search engine Kayak (KYAK -4.1%) has received a cool reception...

    Like Palo Alto Networks, travel search engine Kayak (KYAK -4.1%) has received a cool reception from underwriters: 3 neutral ratings to go with a Buy from Deutsche, which predicts growing consumer awareness, international expansion, and mobile monetization will lead to a 26% revenue CAGR from 2011-14. Morgan Stanley doesn't like the fact Kayak trades at 26x estimated 2013 EPS.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM
  • IDSA

    Industrial Services of America (IDSA -3%) slips after reporting a wider than anticipated Q2 loss...

    Industrial Services of America (IDSA -3%) slips after reporting a wider than anticipated Q2 loss . Additionally, it announces the resignation of its CFO , Robert Coleman, citing personal reasons. An interim CFO will be announced shortly.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM
  • FB

    Facebook (FB -3.8%) and Yelp (YELP -2.9%) sell off following Groupon's Q2 debacle. Yelp could...

    Facebook (FB -3.8%) and Yelp (YELP -2.9%) sell off following Groupon's Q2 debacle. Yelp could also be affected by ongoing concerns about Google/Frommer's. Facebook's first lock-up expiration arrives in two days.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM | 1 Comment
  • PANW

    Palo Alto Networks (PANW -3.6%) slides after receiving 3 bullish and 3 neutral ratings on...

    Palo Alto Networks (PANW -3.6%) slides after receiving 3 bullish and 3 neutral ratings on underwriter coverage day. Goldman is among the bulls, praising the ability of Palo Alto's next-gen firewalls to disrupt a $10B security hardware market by consolidating several products into a single, differentiated box. Morgan Stanley is more guarded due to a high valuation (estimated 11x 2013 EV/sales).

     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM
  • WLTW

    Shares of Towers Watson (TW -10.1%) slip after the company beat on its Q2 bottom line but came...

    Shares of Towers Watson (TW -10.1%) slip after the company beat on its Q2 bottom line but came up short on revenue and cut FY12 guidance. Total sales were slack, falling 3% Y/Y. Despite the weak sales, net revenue soared as the company cut bottom line costs and margins jumped. Going forward however, it sees revenue growth flat at best due to currency impact and weak overall demand, and warns of a potential 10% drop in its EPS for the current quarter.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • MNST

    Monster Beverage (MNST +5.1%) powers up a gain after announcing a well-timed $250M buyback....

    Monster Beverage (MNST +5.1%) powers up a gain after announcing a well-timed $250M buyback. Shares still stand 34% lower than their highs from June when a rumor that Coca-Cola was making a bid for the company popped up - then fizzled just as fast.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM
  • NCR

    NCR (NCR -8.4%) plunges thanks to a WSJ report suggesting the company runs a Syrian subsidiary...

    NCR (NCR -8.4%) plunges thanks to a WSJ report suggesting the company runs a Syrian subsidiary and does business with local banks, potentially in violation of U.S. sanctions. A source close to the company attributes this to a "paperwork mistake," but the Street clearly thinks it could be more serious. Wedbush is downgrading to Neutral in response.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM
  • GRPN

    Groupon (GRPN -23.2%) crashes to $5.80 after missing Q2 revenue forecasts and posting soft...

    Groupon (GRPN -23.2%) crashes to $5.80 after missing Q2 revenue forecasts and posting soft billings due to international weakness. Four firms are downgrading, including Benchmark, which notes gross billings/subscriber fell and argues "the daily deal business has run into a wall." Groupon's blaming of sub-par technology in areas such as deal personalization and mobile for some of its European woes isn't going over well. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM | 2 Comments
  • ANW

    Aegean Marine Petroleum (OTC:ANW +6.4%) jumps as Q2 revenues of $1.89B beat estimates from...

    Aegean Marine Petroleum (OTC:ANW +6.4%) jumps as Q2 revenues of $1.89B beat estimates from analysts, who had expected revenue to drop slightly. Earnings fell 16% as the Greek shipping-fuel supplier recorded a bigger loss from the sale of non-core vessels, masking the revenue growth.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 AM
  • VELTF

    More on Velti's Q2: The company expects Q3 revenue of $60M-$64M and 2012 revenue of $285M-$296M,...

    More on Velti's Q2: The company expects Q3 revenue of $60M-$64M and 2012 revenue of $285M-$296M, in-line with Street estimates of $61.1M and $290.9M. Adjusted EBITDA is expected to grow to $8.5M-$10.5M in Q4 from Q2's $6.2M. Net cash, a concern following Velti's Q1 report, grew by $5.1M. However, DSOs came in at a steep 266 days, down only slightly Q/Q. VELT +18.5%. Together with Millennial Media's strong Q2 report, the results could bode well for Google's mobile ad business. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:36 AM | 3 Comments

  • Market preview: Stock futures point proudly to a higher open after strong retail sales and...

    Market preview: Stock futures point proudly to a higher open after strong retail sales and despite the eurozone contracting. The S&P benchmark is +0.2%. Saxo Bank's Steen Jakobsen notes a major divergence in Dow industrial vs. transport, with bullishness entering "territory where complacency could mean a correction is due." Following earnings, Groupon is getting trashed 22% but Michael Kors races 12.2% higher. Later: Business Inventories
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • VELTF

    Premarket gainers: VELT +16%. KORS +11%. PPHM +10%. EL +7%. Losers: ENVI -46%. GRPN -21%. CRH -7%.

    Premarket gainers: VELT +16%. KORS +11%. PPHM +10%. EL +7%.
    Losers: ENVI -46%. GRPN -21%. CRH -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • HEB

    Hemispherx Biopharma (NYSEMKT:HEB) jumps 10% after the FDA accepts the company's complete...

    Hemispherx Biopharma (NYSEMKT:HEB) jumps 10% after the FDA accepts the company's complete response submission for its New Drug Application for Ampligen, which treats Chronic Fatigue Syndrome. The FDA has set a user-fee data of Feb. 2, 2013, meaning it could make an appoval decision by then. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:04 AM | 1 Comment
  • TJX

    TJX Companies (NYSE:TJX): Q2 EPS of $0.56 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $5.95B (+% Y/Y) misses by...

    TJX Companies (NYSE:TJX): Q2 EPS of $0.56 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $5.95B (+% Y/Y) misses by $40M. Shares -1.3% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:34 AM | 1 Comment
  • MWE

    MarkWest Energy Partners (NYSE:MWE) -4.7% premarket upon launching a public offering of 6M...

    MarkWest Energy Partners (NYSE:MWE) -4.7% premarket upon launching a public offering of 6M common units on the heels of completing a $750M debt offering. The company says it will use net proceeds mostly to buy additional common units to fund its capital spending program.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:26 AM | 1 Comment
  • VELTF

    Velti (VELT): Q2 EPS of -$0.01 in-line. Revenue of $58.7M (+70.6% Y/Y) beats by $1M. Shares +10%...

    Velti (VELT): Q2 EPS of -$0.01 in-line. Revenue of $58.7M (+70.6% Y/Y) beats by $1M. Shares +10% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:15 AM
  • SHW

    Valspar (VAL): FQ3 EPS of $0.97 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $1.08B (+1% Y/Y) misses by $50M....

    Valspar (VAL): FQ3 EPS of $0.97 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $1.08B (+1% Y/Y) misses by $50M. Shares -4.5% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:41 AM
  • AG

    First Majestic (NYSE:AG): Q2 EPS of $0.19 misses by $0.10. Revenue of $54.8M (-19% Y/Y) misses...

    First Majestic (NYSE:AG): Q2 EPS of $0.19 misses by $0.10. Revenue of $54.8M (-19% Y/Y) misses by $5M. Shares -1.3% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:40 AM
  • TPR

    Shares of Coach (COH) run up a 1.2% gain premarket after Michael Kors smashes the estimate of...

    Shares of Coach (COH) run up a 1.2% gain premarket after Michael Kors smashes the estimate of analysts with its FQ1 report. If the move is based on a broad luxury stock runup, HedgeyeRetail sees a fool's rally in play with the strong sales at Michael Kors coming at the direct expense of Coach.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:39 AM | 1 Comment
  • NSM

    More on Nationstar (NYSE:NSM): Adjusted EPS of $0.44 for Q2 is unchanged from previous quarter....

    More on Nationstar (NYSE:NSM): Adjusted EPS of $0.44 for Q2 is unchanged from previous quarter. Servicing portfolio up 87% from Q1 to $193B, thanks to acquisitions from BofA, MetLife, and Aurora. Service fee income +25% Q/Q, Origination revenue +53%. The ResCap affair (in which the company hopes to buy $371B in servicing rights) remains to be settled. Shares -2.3% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:18 AM
  • CPRI

    More on Michael Kors (KORS): Comparable store sales rose 38.4% in North America. Licensing...

    More on Michael Kors (KORS): Comparable store sales rose 38.4% in North America. Licensing revenue increased 61% Y/Y to $17.5M, led by sales of the Michael Kors watch line. Expects FQ2 revenue of $490M-$500M and sees EPS falling in a range of $1.32-$1.34. Shares +8.1% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:16 AM

  • EU shares open higher following better-than-expected French and German GDP, although it's all...

    EU shares open higher following better-than-expected French and German GDP, although it's all still pretty anaemic. EU Stoxx 50 +0.8%, London +0.6%, Paris +0.8%, Frankfurt +0.9%, Madrid +1.05%, Milan +0.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 AM | 1 Comment

  • Asian markets rose ahead of economic data out of Europe and the U.S., with Japan +0.5%, Hong...

    Asian markets rose ahead of economic data out of Europe and the U.S., with Japan +0.5%, Hong Kong +0.5%, China +0.2% and India +0.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 AM
